intro: Diosma capensis, commonly known as the Cape Diosma, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are usually pink or purple and bloom in spring, attracting various pollinators. Diosma capensis is often found in coastal and mountainous regions, where it thrives in full sun.
